columns.text: The goal of this task is to explain how the inclusion of a cancellation option would affect the value of a lease.

LetÂ´s first recall, ***what is a cancellation?***

The cancellation option is one of the most interesting features of an operating lease. This option gives the lessee the right to cancel the lease before its expiration date. When the cancellation takes place, the lessee returns the equipment to the lessor and ends to make payments.

***When the lessee can decide to cancel the lease?***
A lease can be canceled depending on some conditions that make the value of the asset to the lessee less than the present value of the future lease payments. Then, continuing with the lease does not imply benefits for the lessee.

Then, ***how would the inclusion of a cancellation option affect the value of the lease?***

The inclusion of a cancellation option would increase the value of the lease because the cancellation could ensure the lessee always receives only benefits from leasing activity and cancel if the conditions of leasing are not good enough. 

A contract of leasing with this aspect will ensure the lessee's advantage, so it is more attractive.
